perturbation.original_text: Party A provides the invoice of the share of revenues in the preceding month within the first 5 working days in each month in advance, Party B warrants to pay the share of revenues to Party A prior to the 20t h day of each month (postponed in the event of public holidays) according to Article 4.1 hereof. In the event that Party A objects the payment from Party B, it shall propose within the first 5 working days in each month in writing, or it will be deemed as no objection. Party B shall review within three working days upon receipt of Party A's written objection and notify the results thereof to Party A.
perturbation.changed_text: Party A provides the invoice of the share of revenues in the preceding month within the first 15 working days in each month in advance, Party B will pay the share of revenues to Party A prior to the 60th day of the following month (postponed in the event of public holidays) according to Article 4.1 hereof. In the event that Party A objects the payment from Party B, it shall propose within the first 20 working days in each month in writing, or it will be deemed as no objection. Party B shall review within fifteen working days upon receipt of Party A's written objection and notify the results thereof to Party A.
perturbation.explanation: The modification extends the payment period from within the 20th day of each month to the 60th day of the following month, which introduces inconsistencies with standard accounting and business practices that require timely payments. Also, the response deadline to an objection is extended from 3 to 15 working days, thus creating inconsistencies and legal issues.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates accounting regulations and standard business practices requiring timely payments; may contradict laws about payment deadlines

perturbation.original_text: In the event either party breaches its obligations hereunder, the breach party shall immediately suspend its breach upon the receipt of the non-breach party's written notice requiring it to rectify its breach, and pay all the losses to the non-breaching party arising from such breach within ten (10) days. If the breach party continue to carry on the breaching conduct or does not perform its obligations, the non- breaching party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement in addition to the compensation for the breach.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event either party breaches its obligations hereunder, the breach party shall suspend its breach 30 days after the receipt of the non-breach party's written notice requiring it to rectify its breach, and pay all the losses to the non-breaching party arising from such breach within three hundred and sixty-five (365) days. If the breach party continues to carry on the breaching conduct or does not perform its obligations, the non- breaching party shall only have the right to seek mediation.
perturbation.explanation: The modification extends the period for rectifying a breach and paying losses from 10 days to 365 days, thus introducing inconsistencies with industry standards. Moreover, the non-breaching party's right to terminate the agreement is removed and replaced with only the right to seek mediation. This is a conflict with normal breach of contract remedies.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Conflicts with standard contract law principles requiring timely remedies for breach of contract.

perturbation.original_text: Within fifteen (15) days upon the termination of this Agreement, the parties shall delete the links between their websites.
perturbation.changed_text: Within ninety (90) days upon the termination of this Agreement, the parties can maintain the links between their websites if they desire.
perturbation.explanation: The modification extends the period for deleting links between websites from 15 days to 90 days and adds the condition of maintaining links between their websites. This can create inconsistencies with intellectual property laws if the content on the websites infringes the intellectual property of the other party.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential conflict with intellectual property law, depending on the content of the websites.
